{{Infobox software |name = Nero Burning ROM |logo = |screenshot = [[File:Nero Burning ROM.png|300px]] |caption = |developer = [[Nero AG]] |released = {{Start date and age|1997|df=yes}} |latest release version = 11.0.10400 |latest release date = {{Start date and age|2011|10|05|df=yes}} |operating system = [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Linux]] |genre = [[Optical disc authoring software]] |programming language = |license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]] [[commercial software]] |website = {{URL|http://www.nero.com/}} }} '''Nero Burning ROM''', commonly called '''Nero''', is an [[optical disc authoring software|optical disc authoring program]] for [[Microsoft Windows]] by [[Nero AG]] (formerly Ahead Software) located in Germany.{{cite news | url = http://www.theinquirer.net/default.aspx?article=37873 | title = 'Nero Lite' and 'Nero Micro': smaller sometimes is better | first = Fernando | last = Cassia | date = 2007-02-27 | publisher = [[The Inquirer]] | accessdate = 2007-03-07 }} Versions 6 to 9 were a part of [[Nero Multimedia Suite]]. As of version 10, Nero Burning Rom is available as a stand-alone product.{{cite web|url=http://www.nero.com/enu/pressreleases.html?id=1801 |title=Nero Multimedia Suite 10 Now Available |publisher=Nero AG |date=2010-04-12}} Nero Linux is the Linux version. ==Features== Nero Burning ROM supports the creation of{{cite web |url= http://www.nero.com/enu/nero-burning-rom-system-requirements.html |title= Nero Burning ROM System Requirements |accessdate= 2011-01-26 |publisher= Nero AG }}: * [[ISO 9660|ISO]]/[[Universal Disk Format|UDF]] data discs * [[boot disk|Bootable discs]] * [[Red Book (CD standard)|Audio CD]] discs * [[DVD-Video]] discs * [[Blu-ray Disc]]s * [[AVCHD]] video discs * SecurDisc discs * [[Disk image]] files Other functions include: * [[CD ripper|Ripping audio CDs]] * Converting audio files to other audio file formats * Erasing rewritable discs * Printing on discs with [[LightScribe]] and [[LabelFlash]] technology * Connection to the online music database [[Gracenote]] Nero contains a player for DVDs, video files, audio files, an [[image viewer]], and software to assist with [[DVD authoring|production of DVDs]] and other multimedia content. Nero Burning ROM Lite and [[OEM]] versions (with hardware purchase only) are cheaper, hardware specific, reduced functionality versions of Nero Burning ROM. ==Image format support== Nero Burning ROM works with a number of [[optical disc image]] formats, including the raw uncompressed image following the [[ISO9660]] standard, and Nero's proprietary [[NRG (file format)|NRG]] [[file format]]. Depending on version more image formats may be natively supported. To use more formats, particularly lossless [[FLAC]], [[Wavpack]], and [[Shorten]], it is necessary to install additional program modules. The modules, called [[plug-in (computing)|plug-in]]s or [[codec]]s, are often freely available. Nero AG sells some video and proprietary audio plug-ins.Notably multi-channel, e.g. [[Dolby Digital|Dolby Digital 5.1]] and [[mp3pro]]. ==Variety== * '''Nero Burning Rom''' - the full version of the application, intended for advanced PC users. * '''Nero Express''' - a simplified edition of Nero Burning ROM targeted at entry-level users, is available with the Nero software suite. Although Nero Express is not as powerful as the full-featured Nero Burning ROM, it features a more streamlined user interface, and offers a broader range of features than those offered by Windows. Nero Express is also integrated into Nero software suite, especially into OEM editions of this software which lack Nero Burning ROM. * '''Nero Kwik Burn''' is a component of the freeware software suite '''Nero Kwik Media''' and provides only basic CD/DVD copying and creation options. It was initially released alongside version 9.4.12.3 as a standalone program called '''Nero BurnLite'''.{{cite web |url= http://www.nero.com/deu/downloads-nbl-free.php |title= Nero BurnLite |accessdate= 2011-11-08 |publisher= Nero AG }} * '''Nero Linux'''{{cite web |url= http://www.nero.com/enu/linux4.html |title= Nero Linux |accessdate= 2011-01-26 |publisher= Nero AG }} is a more recent standalone incarnation of Nero Burning ROM that works on various distributions of [[Linux]]. ==Name== The program's name is confirmed to be a [[play on words]], as it looks like "[[Nero]] Burning [[Rome]]" (see [[Great Fire of Rome]]) and more so when translated to other Latin and Germanic languages.{{cite web |url=http://www.itreviews.co.uk/software/s69.htm |title=Ahead Software - Nero Burning ROM review |date=5 April 2000 |publisher=IT Reviews |accessdate=3 March 2010}} ==Version history== ===Nero Burning ROM=== {| class="wikitable" |- !
